name: Kepler-227
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-227 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-227 is a star with 1.085 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.09 times its radius. It is located 3644.79 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-227 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-227 b

Kepler-227 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.49 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-227.

The mass of Kepler-227 b is 14.59 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-227 b is 3.11 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-227 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-227 c

Kepler-227 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 54.42 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-227.

The mass of Kepler-227 c is 13.85 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-227 c is 3.04 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-227 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-227, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
